subject: [HW 05] Q2: Vending Machine
content:
Q2: Vending Machine

Please post all questions you have below concerning Q2: Vending Machine in the follow-ups.

If you are stuck on this question, feel free to read through the follow-up responses to see if you can draw any ideas from them.

threads.question: I defined a vend( ) method under class VendingMachine, it takes I no argument but I keep getting “vend( ) takes 0 positional arguments but 1 was given” error. Can someone help me?

follow-ups.feedback: vend() should take in a parameter of self so you can use the dot notation on VendingMachine objects.

threads.question: I got the error "unsupported operand type(s) for +: 'method' and 'int'" on "self.deposit = self.deposit + amount". I have deposit as a class attribute but I don't know why I'm getting this error.

follow-ups.feedback: self.deposit is also a method in the class, hence doing self.deposit will make it evaluate to a bound method of the class. You cannot add methods and integers. Consider renaming your deposit instance variable so the name doesn't clash with the deposit method.

threads.question: I got this error but I'm not sure why the deposit isn't adding correctly here. It works for previous calls.![](/redirect/s3?bucket=uploads&prefix=attach%2Fjziyku5gomy7aq%2Fjzqdhg01so23yc%2Fk1oc1yrpjb9u%2F%E5%B1%8F%E5%B9%95%E5%BF%AB%E7%85%A7_20191012_%E4%B8%8B%E5%8D%886.50.44.png)
keep getting this error and i don't know why  ![](/redirect/s3?bucket=uploads&prefix=attach%2Fjziyku5gomy7aq%2Fjzqdi5ew7if4c9%2Fk1sjlsdplv40%2FScreen_Shot_20191015_at_5.33.36_PM.png)

follow-ups.feedback: Vend not only returns a string but also brings about a change in values of certain attributes if the function prerequisites are met.      From what I can conclude from your test cases, depositing money in the vending money has no effect on the overall money required. Hence, even after depositing $7, you get the same message ('You must deposit $10 more.') that you did before depositing $7.
ah okay i will take a look at it again, thank you!

threads.question: TypeError: VendingMachine() takes no arguments  How do I fix this error?

follow-ups.feedback: your current constructor takes in no arguments - what arguments should it take in, according to the doctest?

threads.question: Getting this error: Is this an error in the autograder or my code?![](/redirect/s3?bucket=uploads&prefix=attach%2Fjziyku5gomy7aq%2Fjzqdirh1twx4pm%2Fk1zod801doe8%2FPIAZZA.PNG)

I keep getting a keyerror whenever I try to run lines that have been string formatted (so they contain { } that usually denote dictionaries). Is anyone else getting this issue, and if so, how can I get around it?

follow-ups.feedback: Make sure you're passing in the proper parameters / number of parameters

threads.question: I know that this is probably a stupid question but i cannot get this to print correctly for the love of god so if someone could give me an example of how to correctly print something similar to this that would be super helpful  ![](/redirect/s3?bucket=uploads&prefix=attach%2Fjziyku5gomy7aq%2Fjhb2sk402bj3ob%2Fk22c0zlhnu45%2FScreen_Shot_20191022_at_1.58.58_PM.png)

follow-ups.feedback: how do i get it to return the actual number, not the word im passing into deposit?
it seems like you are returning in this case, instead of printing. in terms of formatting strings, there is information about that on the spec for this question on the homework page.

threads.question: Where should I be looking at?  ![](/redirect/s3?bucket=uploads&prefix=attach%2Fjziyku5gomy7aq%2Fjr5gk45uqr445h%2Fk22vgfanszi4%2FScreen_Shot_20191022_at_23.03.07.png)

follow-ups.feedback: see the line of code that executed right above the line that errored - the user just bought candy, and machine gave back change.
